channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Strikes Rock Lebanon as Iran’s Leader Issues Warning
item.description: It was not clear if an Israeli attack near Beirut had killed its target, the presumed successor to Hezbollah’s slain leader. In Iran, Ayatollah Ali Kh...

item.title: How an Uber Eats Order Unraveled a Couple’s Injury Lawsuit
item.description: A New Jersey couple sued Uber after a crash left them severely injured. An appeals court ruled that they had agreed to settle disputes out of court wh...

item.title: ‘Mom, I Want to Live’: A Young Girl Battles War and Cancer
item.description: Sonya Liakh was diagnosed with eye cancer at age 2. After Russia’s invasion of Ukraine disrupted her treatment, her family faced a desperate struggle.

item.title: Spirit Airlines might go bankrupt months after calling off a sale to JetBlue—and its stock is in a tailspin
item.description: Restructuring could come after failed merger with JetBlue.

item.title: TikTok star with 8+ million followers charged in killing of Louisiana therapist
item.description: Terryon Thomas, also known as Mr. Prada, has two TikTok accounts with over 4 million followers each.

item.title: ‘Why Us?’: A Tide of Grief in Lebanon
item.description: Mourners reeled over lost loved ones after an Israeli strike on an apartment building killed at least 45 people.

item.title: Garth Brooks accused of rape in lawsuit from hair-and-makeup artist
item.description: The woman alleges two instances of assault in 2019.

item.title: Jobs Report Adds to Economic Momentum for Harris
item.description: In recent weeks, reports have shown inflation slowing and the economy growing at a robust clip. The Federal Reserve has also cut interest rates, bring...

item.title: Europe Raises Tariffs on China’s E.V.s, Confronting a Key Trade Partner
item.description: European Union officials say the duties are meant to protect the region’s automakers from what they say are unfair trade practices in China.

item.title: Champions League’s New Format Creates a New Reality
item.description: This year more than ever is showing that the competition means different things to different clubs. And that’s a good thing.

item.title: Want to win Gen Z over? Plug into trends and offer convenience
item.description: This generation seeks brands that align with its values, says Nick Antonelli, chief marketing officer of Bread Financial.

item.title: E.U. Court Says Some Rules for Soccer’s Transfer Market Are Illegal
item.description: A decision could force soccer’s governing body to rewrite the regulations that govern the sport’s multibillion-dollar transfer market.

item.title: A Recipe for a Striving America
item.description: The question is not whether to do industrial policy, but how.

item.title: ‘Mom, I Want to Live’: A Young Girl Battles War and Cancer
item.description: Sonya Liakh was diagnosed with eye cancer at age 2. After Russia’s invasion of Ukraine disrupted her treatment, her family faced a desperate struggle.

item.title: Helene is the deadliest hurricane in 20 years—and the government says it doesn’t have enough funding to last through the season
item.description: Another hurricane is expected to hit in the coming days.
